name: Ra
title: Amun-Ra - King of the Gods | Egyptian Mythology
epithets: King of the Gods, The Hidden Sun
description:
Ra stands as one of the most ancient and mysterious figures in Egyptian mythology. 

According to Egyptian sacred texts, Ra's origins arise from the primordial waters of Nun, manifesting divine order (Ma'at) from chaos The worship of Ra became central to Egyptian religious practice, with devotees seeking their favor through temple offerings, festival processions, and elaborate funerary rites. 

Sacred symbols associated with Ra include egyptian symbolism. These emblems appear throughout Egyptian art and literature, serving as powerful reminders of Ra's divine presence and authority. The mythology surrounding Ra reveals deep insights into Egyptian worldview, particularly concerning unknown and humanity's relationship with the divine. 

The legacy of Ra extends far beyond ancient Egyptian civilization. Ra captivates the modern imagination through museum exhibitions, esoteric traditions, and popular media. The deity's iconography remains instantly recognizable worldwide Scholars continue to study Ra's mythology for its profound insights into Egyptian culture, religion, and philosophy.

listDisplay.expandedContent: Amun-Rais the syncretic fusion ofAmun(thehidden one) andRa(the sun). Supreme god of the New Kingdom, combiningAmun's mysterious transcendence withRa's manifest solarpower. 'King of the Gods' worshipped at Karnak's vast temple complex. Consort of Mut, father of Khonsu. Pharaohs claimed divine descent fromAmun-Ra.

epithets: King of the Gods, The Hidden Sun

sections.title: Description
sections.content: Amun-Rais the syncretic fusion ofAmun(thehidden one) andRa(the sun). Supreme god of the New Kingdom, combiningAmun's mysterious transcendence withRa's manifest solarpower. 'King of the Gods' worshipped at Karnak's vast temple complex. Consort of Mut, father of Khonsu. Pharaohs claimed divine descent fromAmun-Ra.

epithets: King of the Gods, The Hidden Sun

summary: Amun-Rais the syncretic fusion ofAmun(thehidden one) andRa(the sun).  Supreme god of the New Kingdom, combiningAmun's mysterious transcendence withRa's manifest solarpower.
cultural_significance: A significant deity in egyptian mythology, widely worshipped and culturally influential.

topic_panels.title: Origins & Mythology
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Origins

Ra's mythology primordial waters (Nun), creator gods, cosmogonies. The deity's role in Egyptian cosmology reflects fundamental aspects of how ancient peoples understood divine power and cosmic order.

### Creation Accounts

Primary sources describe Ra's emergence and divine nature through various sacred narratives. These origin stories served both religious and cultural functions, establishing divine authority and cosmic principles.

**Time Period:** c. 3000 BCE - 400 CE

topic_panels.title: Worship & Practice
topic_panels.content:
### Religious Practice

Worship of Ra involved temple rituals, festivals, funerary practices. These practices created sacred bonds between devotees and the divine realm.

### Sacred Sites

Throughout Ancient Egypt, Nile Valley, temples and shrines dedicated to Ra served as focal points for religious activity. Priests and priestesses maintained sacred rituals that ensured divine favor and cosmic balance.

### Festivals & Ceremonies

Special festivals celebrated Ra's divine attributes and mythological deeds, bringing communities together in shared religious expression.

topic_panels.title: Symbols & Iconography
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Symbols

Key symbols associated with Ra:

- **egyptian symbolism**: Represents divine power and sacred authority

### Divine Attributes

The iconography reveals how ancient peoples visualized divine power and cosmic forces.

### Artistic Representations

Ancient artworks depict Ra with distinctive attributes that communicate divine identity and authority to worshippers.

topic_panels.title: Modern Influence
topic_panels.content:
### Cultural Legacy

Hermeticism, Western esotericism, popular culture. The mythology of Ra continues to resonate in contemporary culture, literature, and spiritual practices.

### Academic Study

Modern scholars analyze Ra's mythology through multiple lenses‚Äîreligious studies, anthropology, archaeology, and comparative mythology‚Äîrevealing insights into ancient worldviews.

### Popular Culture

Ra appears in modern media, from fantasy novels to video games, demonstrating the enduring power of ancient mythology to capture human imagination and address timeless questions.

related_myths.title: The Birth of Ra
related_myths.summary: The sacred account of how Ra came into being, establishing their divine authority and cosmic role in Egyptian mythology.

related_myths.title: Ra and the Sacred Quest
related_myths.summary: A legendary tale of Ra's heroic deeds or cosmic achievements that shaped the world and demonstrated divine power.

related_myths.title: Ra and the Divine Council
related_myths.summary: Stories of Ra's interactions with other deities, revealing the complex relationships and hierarchies of the Egyptian pantheon.

related_myths.title: The Legacy of Ra
related_myths.summary: How Ra's actions and teachings continue to influence the world, establishing sacred traditions and cosmic principles.
